title: Mobile PBL Projects for Environmental Literacy and Higher-Order Thinking Skills Development

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of advanced courses and extensive practical experience in specialized fields
context.additional_context: Social Studies Curriculum Combining Project-Based Learning and Multiliteracies Pedagogy in a Smartphone-Centric Limited-Technology Environment. Designed around real-life problem-solving considering job seeker roles

learning_goals: Students can analyze and integrate digital/media resources to propose practical solutions for addressing environmental issues
Learners enhance critical thinking and decision-making skills regarding complex environmental problems through PBL (Project-Based Learning) activities

Students will plan one environmental campaign reflecting sustainable consumption habits (e.g., zero-waste, upcycling) through a 4-week team-based project (3–5 members), recruit and execute the campaign with over 50 participants on campus, and demonstrate a 30%+ improvement in campaign effectiveness via pre- and post-surveys.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
